document.title: Model School Library Standards for California Public Schools, Kindergarten Through Grade Twelve

3F770F8F984F4DB6AC20F2F116E3214B.description: Understand that genre is a term that describes types of literary works that are similar (e.g., drama, fable, fairy tale, fantasy, folklore, essay, speech).

E0736BF0AA1C46DAAE9DF3DB0BBEAD38.description: Appreciate and respond to creative expressions of information:

8EF4469B64CB4D848C4F43FCC361CA23.description: Understand the basic components of information literacy (e.g., identify, access, evaluate, and use information effectively).

C0D11598692F42368041AA4F7F36336E.description: Demonstrate maturity in consideration of others, both in person and during communications and interactions using technology.

403AEA3E1B354A94A9753939A2B150F1.description: Read a good representation of grade-level-appropriate text, making progress toward the goal of reading one million words annually by grade eight (e.g., classic and contemporary literature, magazines, newspapers, online information).

479060256D80404BBBC9FB1F243C9BA9.description: Read widely and use various media for information, personal interest, and lifelong learning:

90752B1E68704DE484356531F1E8BF0E.description: Students integrate information literacy skills into all areas of learning.

92641D3DBD4343B18A11D975A8A00A0F.description: Use a thesaurus to edit and revise manuscripts to improve the meaning and focus of writing.

A83974DDD1DA469BBCA2F59ABB72DF67.description: Use information and technology creatively to answer a question, solve a problem, or enrich understanding:

9C42EF84C70647B9ACCADAD08C8C3D6A.description: Use more than one resource, when needed, to verify and determine accuracy.

D854501B43CA47D68B7FC5CC17830002.description: Draw conclusions and make informed decisions:

ECCA4F6169A24E6398C7E4AD8C01218B.description: Recognize suspicious online offers and invitations (e.g., spam, phishing, polls, contests).

3B105E42146E458AB9207EB0F5B718B9.description: Use basic safety procedures when online (e.g., e-mailing, texting, chatting).

093B7E46262F46B3A7236D867AAC01C5.description: Demonstrate legal and ethical behavior in information use.

A1A8AFBA0CC046DAB9608938662B3115.description: Demonstrate an understanding of and show respect for personal intellectual property.

3382395377E449E58BCFCBACB0251AC2.description: Record bibliographic information in an acceptable format.

6356A0E69A9243A4BA70C2BF30062F8F.description: Demonstrate ethical, legal, and safe use of information in print, media, and online resources:

D5E77533D5A744E8954C335680AEAB5B.description: Ask questions that seek information not already located.

87D66E4D4F48412F861BE504D4A9320A.description: Evaluate information located to determine whether more information is needed and, if so, identify additional resources to search.

BCC16B56A32F42879714A405CED22E59.description: Consider the need for additional information:

CCDE798B4D134D9DA1F41636DB4DD70E.description: Evaluate Internet resources for accuracy, credibility, and relevance.

0C4A18E6752044C08D93843401157163.description: Identify and assess evidence that supports the main ideas and concepts presented in texts.

F671D864C0904B3B83DCD1B5FA58E25C.description: Describe how media resources serve as sources of information, entertainment, persuasion, interpretation of events, and transmission of culture.

770907AB13E44FADA952848E9A0ADD36.description: Assess the comprehensiveness, currency, credibility, authority, and accuracy of resources:

BA723C0B1E4F4BF2B14DC8EDAB0FFACE.description: Assess how new information confirms and/or changes the original questions (e.g., what I know, what I want to know, and what I learned [KWL] chart).

2AD1EB961C7F475792378F624F72A499.description: Determine the relevance of the information:

1DDB467E71F54BE5B85708F756F501BD.description: Locate relevant information by using specialized features of print (e.g., citations, endnotes, preface, appendix, bibliographic references) and digital text (e.g., key word, controlled vocabulary).

CE6FA17A6F4C4BD3BF958AC783C96853.description: Use scanning and skimming skills to locate relevant information.

54C16E3FBA904F8BBE537EDE0698B909.description: Compare and contrast information obtained from library catalogs, subscription databases, and open-ended search engines on the Internet.

E7BA10E68A0045FA93858B07967BDDD7.description: Retrieve information in a timely, safe, and responsible manner:

DADC4D7EDB72418081BE67E7870E9E96.description: Create and use complex key word searches to find specific information online.

3C415FD3C24641799DBFECEBEA0EA810.description: Use the library catalog to locate biographies available in the library.

E82C9F0C655642B1BFA48363A14A2267.description: Use features of electronic text for locating information (e.g., indexes, key words, see and see also cross-references).

B11F188207CD4F48BF529C2DDDD7C578.description: Understand how text features make information accessible and usable (e.g., chapter headings, subheadings, captions, indexes).

6585065F1CA8499A84CFAE13F73A9756.description: Use appropriate reference materials, both print and online, to obtain needed information.

EA3E2295072D4F359A52591FDB86FFDB.description: Identify a variety of online information sources.

F9B6864995164C6896152E80A255DCD6.description: Use call numbers, spine labels, and the library classification system to locate information in the library.

698E3204278B4C5783FDA9E351031297.description: Interpret information from the automated library catalog.

A81B7CA731374E369C44658FEE46AA53.description: Use a thesaurus to identify word choices and meanings to facilitate research.

07F9EE6433FC4090896755AC53966C02.description: Identify and locate a variety of resources online and in other formats by using effective search strategies:

427ECF0CE0EE4D65B816C845B14F22D1.description: Use key words, phrases, and notes to create an outline.

0FAAF31E99294CC7A27046DA315A419F.description: Formulate and refine questions that cover the necessary scope and direction of the investigation.

11B4884DD87B48518C5060A38D614845.description: Define the topic of a research investigation.
